caption.p: Type I and type II IFNs play distinct roles in the pathogenesis of SLEV infection in mice. (a) WT and ABR −/- mice in the SV129 background were inoculated intracranially with 10 2 PFU of SLEV and observed for 14 days. (b) WT and IFNγ −/- mice in the C57BL/6 background were inoculated intracranially with 10 PFU of SLEV and observed for 14 days. Results are expressed as percentage of survival and are representative of three independent experiments (n = 10–18). *P < 0.05, ***P < 0.001 relative to the infected WT group. Mock – uninfected mice inoculated with saline
